result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:09 PM CO: TCH, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trevyn Ray Nelson-Blauvelt appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Trevyn Ray Nelson-Blauvelt. Includes 22CM246 & 22CM427.  DE qualifies for PD.  DE updates address and phone number.  Court quashes warrant in 22CM246. On 22CM246- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  On 22CM427- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG both counts.  Waives speedy trial. Court sets bond.
Settlement conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Includes 22CM246 and 22CM427

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Walmart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
